primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (in Christ) enters the 'hour of darkness' to submit to the Power of Death and thereby rescue humanity from cosmic bondage.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus knowingly stages his own entrance
He humbled himself and became obedient unto death
This is the way that God chose to save us... by submitting to it himself

object.identificatie: Salvation/Rescue of humanity from the Power of Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the final drama of the salvation of the world
save us from that power that held us in bondage
the lowly beast of burden that was prophesied by Zechariah
This is the way that God chose

ontvanger.identificatie: The sinful human being / The congregation
tekstueel_bewijs: eternal consequence for the whole world
claim those whom he calls to his everlasting Jerusalem
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the repentant thief) rather than the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Liturgy / The Holy Week Narrative
tekstueel_bewijs: The Palm Sunday liturgy has a sort of genius about it
The church commemorates and dramatizes the victory
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the liturgy is the Helper that enables the hearer to 'see' the Subject's work.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly an external power drawing the hearer ('drawn even to the possibility').

tegenstander.identificatie: The Power of Darkness / Death / The Devil / Secular False Narratives
tekstueel_bewijs: that face is waiting whose sight alone is the misery
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but a cosmic 'Power' that holds humanity in bondage and requires God's own submission to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response: choosing to immerse oneself in the story of Jesus rather than secular narratives.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Spiritual identity/Grasping the meaning of Easter
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's 'doing' (coming to church, looking at the cross) is a response to the primary action of Christ's 'doing'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus knowingly stages his own entrance
The Son of God [victories] over the dark Powers
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You have made a very important choice
We live according to the whims of the Power of Death
Let us be that thief today

voorbeelden: you will want to be here
drawn even to the possibility of believing
We are here to learn once again
understand our place in the story
the power of darkness, having exhausted itself upon him, will have no power to claim those...

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of Darkness being broken by the 'Power' of Christ, rather than the 'Obligation' (Devoir) of the believer.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (secular stories) to S2 (the reality of the cross/death) to S1 (Paradise via Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the S2 position (Death) to move the Receiver from ~S1 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death and darkness are treated as ontological realities, not just metaphors.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as 'bondage' and God as the sole agent of rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: you, the people of this congregation, have made a very important choice today

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: This is the way that God chose to save us... by submitting to it himself
the Power of Death... that face is waiting whose sight alone is misery

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Judas, Peter, the Thief) are used as mirrors for the human condition, not as moral models to emulate, except for the thief's 'throwing himself on mercy'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The thief is not a model of 'goodness' but a model of 'receiving' (Receiver actant).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the reality of 'being rescued'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is an act of God upon a helpless subject.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'false stories' of the world to the 'true story' of the cross is seamless and logically consistent.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: victory of the Son of God over the dark Powers

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the objective work of Christ (the Story) rather than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'Power' that requires God's death to break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a cosmic rescue.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase 'Pouvoir' (the Spirit's current power in the believer).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'victory over dark powers' to the believer's current struggles with those same powers.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Excellent; the Opponent is properly cosmic.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's death) strictly precedes and enables the response (coming to the table).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of moralism by taking the 'Power of Darkness' seriously and keeping Christ as the active Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the laundry/advertising anecdotes, semiotics reveals these are 'false senders' in the actantial model.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of Luke; semiotics explains how the sermon functions as a 'rescue mission' narrative for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'choice' to come to church is a secondary program, subordinate to the primary program where Christ is the only one capable of acting against the 'Opponent' (Death).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Repentant Thief' as the bridge for the hearer to move from 'Opponent' (complicit in death) to 'Receiver' (Paradise).
